def_1: a change in a process or situation, usually when it gets worse for a short time before it gets better; a temporary problem

def_2: a short high sound made by an electronic device

def_1: not securely fixed where it should be; able to become separated from something
example_set_1: a loose button/tooth
Check that the plug has not come loose.
One of the bricks feels slightly loose.
Darien shook his arm loose.
def_2: not tied together; not held in position by anything or contained in anything
example_set_2: She usually wears her hair loose.
She tucked a loose strand of hair behind her ear.
The potatoes were sold loose, not in bags.
def_3: free to move around without control; not tied up or shut in somewhere
example_set_3: The sheep had got out and were loose on the road.
The horse had broken loose (= escaped) from its tether.
The animals ran loose without collars or leashes.
During the night, somebody had cut the boat loose from its moorings.
def_4: not fitting closely
example_set_4: On long flights, wear loose clothing and comfortable shoes.
a loose shirt
def_5: not tightly packed together; not solid or hard
example_set_5: loose soil
a fabric with a loose weave
def_6: not strictly organized or managed
example_set_6: a loose association of artists, writers and composers
def_7: not exact; not very careful
example_set_7: This is only a loose translation as I am not fluent in Japanese.
This book is an antidote for much of the loose thinking in the world of today.
The committees work within fairly loose guidelines.
def_8: having or involving an attitude to sexual relationships that people consider to be morally wrong
example_set_8: a young man of loose morals
def_9: not in any player’s control
example_set_9: He pounced on a loose ball.
def_10: having too much liquid in it
example_set_10: a baby with loose bowel movements
def_11: suddenly there was a lot of noise, arguing, fighting, etc.
def_12: to separate yourself or somebody/something from a group of people or their influence, etc.
def_13: to remain calm; to not worry
def_14: to talk too much, especially about things that are private
def_15: to be slightly strange in your behaviour
def_16: to do something or to happen in a way that no one controls
def_17: to make a noise or remark, especially in a loud or sudden way
def_18: to free somebody/something from whatever holds them/it in place
def_19: to give somebody complete freedom to do what they want in a place or situation
def_20: to treat somebody/something in a way that shows that you feel no responsibility or respect for them

def_2: having a sharp exciting quality

the Ska beat, faster than reggae and a bit edgier

def_1: a tube or passage down which people or things can slide

a laundry/rubbish/garbage chute (= from the upper floors of a high building)
def_2: a parachute (= a device that is attached to people or objects to make them fall slowly and safely when they are dropped from an aircraft. It consists of a large piece of thin cloth that opens out in the air.)

def_1: dried up and dead
example_set_1: withered leaves
def_2: looking old because they are thin and weak and have very dry skin
def_3: thin and weak and not fully developed because of disease

def_1: the tops of the legs and buttocks; the similar parts at the back of the body of an animal that has four legs

def_2: a back leg and loin of an animal that has four legs, eaten as food

def_1: a small piece of information or news

def_2: a short piece of a conversation, piece of music, etc.

def_1: a short piece of writing or acting that clearly shows what a particular person, situation, etc. is like

def_2: a small picture or drawing, especially on the first page of a book

def_1: to state formally that somebody is not guilty or responsible for something

def_2: to give absolution to somebody
example_set_2: I absolve you from all your sins.

def_1: shelter or protection from danger, trouble, etc.
example_set_1: A further 300 people have taken refuge in the US embassy.

def_2: a place, person or thing that provides shelter or protection for somebody/something
example_set_2: The marshes are a wetland refuge for seabirds, waders and wild fowl.

def_3: a building that provides a temporary home for people in need of shelter or protection from somebody/something
example_set_3: The best option for a female victim of domestic abuse is to contact a women's refuge.

def_4: an area in the middle of a road where you can stand and wait for cars to go past until it is safe for you to cross

def_1: connected with beauty and art and the understanding of beautiful things

an aesthetic appreciation of the landscape

def_2: made in an artistic way and beautiful to look at
example_set_2: Their furniture was more aesthetic than functional.

def_1: the qualities and ideas in a work of art or literature that relate to beauty and the nature of art
example_set_1: NoExamples
def_2: the branch of philosophy that studies the principles of beauty, especially in art
example_set_2: The students debated the aesthetic of the poems.

def_1: a piece of writing, music, acting, etc. that deliberately copies the style of somebody/something in order to be humorous

def_2: something that is such a bad or an unfair example of something that it seems silly

def_1: to show a lack of respect for somebody, especially by ignoring them when you meet

def_2: to refuse to attend or accept something, for example as a protest

def_1: very enthusiastic about something (often a hobby)

def_2: wanting to get something very much

def_1: humorous

def_2: enjoying making people laugh

def_1: to make a hole or a tunnel in the ground by digging

def_2: to press yourself close to somebody or under something
example_set_2: He burrowed down beneath the blankets.

def_3: to search for something under or among things
example_set_3: She burrowed in the drawer for a pair of socks.

def_1: the part of the body between the head and the shoulders

def_4: a long narrow part of something

def_5: the neck of an animal, cooked and eaten

def_6: to have a lot of something to deal with
def_7: a combination of confidence and lack of respect

def_8: to watch closely what somebody is doing in a way that makes them feel anxious and/or annoyed
def_9: if a person or an animal wins a race by a neck, they win it by a short distance
example_set_9: NoExamples
def_10: roughly holding the back of an animal’s or person’s neck
example_set_10: NoExamples
def_11: to be shouted at or punished because of something that you have done

def_13: level with somebody in a race or competition

def_20: to do or say something when there is a risk that you may be wrong

def_1: making you feel comfortable, as if you were in your own home

example_set_5: NoExamples

def_1: to get something from somebody by asking

def_1: a sea creature with a hard shell, eight legs and two pincers (= curved and pointed arms for catching and holding things). Crabs move sideways (= towards the side) on land.

def_1: how large or small a person or thing is

def_1: a sweet drink that does not contain alcohol, made from fruit juice. It is drunk with water added.
